Tucson raises the frequency on his transmitter as the ship shudders.  He's =
quick to take the co pilot's chair and quickly goes to work on helping Lord=
 Elder to steady the shuttle.  Of course it takes a few touches over the da=
shboard to find the control handles and within no time, he sits down and fe=
els over the controls in the co pilot's chair.  Without brail symbols to gu=
ide him he struggles in trying to find the right controls to steady the cra=
ft.  Rat Trap quickly bounds over and guides his hands to the proper contro=
ls.

" That's it, that's right, third button on the left control pannel, th=
at'll equalize the engine power on your side, and hopefully work in tandem =
with the boosters on Lord Elder's side."

Tucson smiles.

"Thanks Rat Trap.=
  All right Lord Elder, I'll help you to land the shuttle, I have a feeling=
 you'll need more than just yourself to pilot the craft.  Kup, this is Tucs=
on, if you can hear me, I need to know how to revive the other Autobots if =
possible.  I'm planning to get Rodimus out of danger but I'll need backup. =
 In his current state he's not cooperative enough to come readilly."

He th=
en turns to Rat Trap and the others.

" All right, Lord Elder really needs =
your help guys, we have a bad situation and we want to prevent it from gett=
ing any worse.  First, we need to cover the Maximal base, then we also need=
 to cover the Ark. As an Autobot, I need to go where I'm most needed, and t=
hat's to the Ark, which right now is at its most vulnerable state.  I'll jo=
in up with Kup there, and do my part to keep the ark safe."

Rat Trap steps=
 forward as does Quickstride.

" We'll go ta the Maximal base Wheels.  It's=
 about time we did our share of the dirty work."

Tucson gives a smile.

"T=
hank you, both of you.  Trust me, you will not go unrewarded.  All right, n=
ow, onto more intricate issues...  Rat Trap, how much do you know about Pre=
dacon technology?"

Rat Trap beams with delight after Tucsons' question.

"=
Quite a bit actually.  What in particular do ya wanna know?"

Tucson gives =
a look of deep thought.

" Rodimus, I need to know how the Predacons altere=
d his physical and mental properties.  A form of twisted programming is at =
play and I was wondering if you knew anything about it."

Rat Trap scampers=
 up to a computer terminal, and lets his fingers to the walking.

"I've act=
ually been don' a lotta homework on that even before Rodimus got swiped by =
those preds.  It's a shell program that they developed, they must've tapped=
 inta his neurologic circuitry that somehow changed his physical appearence=
 as well as his mental state."

Tucson was onto something.  His fingers tap=
 against the dash board as more and more comes into mind.

" Like all progr=
ams I assume they can be infiltrated by outside sources?"

Rat Trap sighs.
=

"Might not be all that easy, Wheels.  But I definitely see where you're ge=
ttn' at..."

Tucson taps his fingers.  No doubt involved in a major brain s=
torm.

" No doubt they've erased all ties with Autobot technology... I won'=
t be able to access it remotely, but you might be able to tap into the Pred=
acon programming since your knowledge of it is rather extensive.  Rat Trap,=
 can you try to tap into Rodimus via Predacon code?"

Rat Trap types away a=
t a terminal.

" Won't be easy, but I'll give it my best shot.  Once we kno=
w what we're dealn' with, we'll be able ta reverse it's effects."

Tucson t=
urns to Lord Elder.  Things were beginning to fall into place, and instead =
of not knowing what to do, things were just happening naturally for him, an=
d yes, his feeling of being lost, finally fades to a feeling of now knowing=
 where that road was taking him.

" We may not have a lot of men on our sid=
e Lord Elder, but if all goes to plan, we might just gain back another valu=
able member of our team.  Let's hope that what we're doing here, can help b=
ring Rodimus back to where he truely belongs and give Scourge, Hydras, and =
Cyclonus something to seriously think about."

Rat Trap looks over to Tucso=
n.

"What about Night Light?"

Tucson nodds.

" Once we recover and restore=
 Rodimus, I'm pretty sure he'll be wanting to get Nightlight out of there a=
s well.  Things will fall into place Rat Trap, we just need to be patient a=
nd wait out the storm.  But that doesn't mean we're just going to sit back =
and do nothing while we wait."

Rat Trap grins while going back to work.  H=
e knew exactly what Tucson was up to and was loving every minute of it.  Qu=
ickstride readies his weapon, and reloads it with fresh ammo.

" I'm sure g=
lad we're finally doing something about the Predacons and the Decepticons. =
 Maybe now things will quiet down around here.  It'll be really nice ta hea=
r the engines of the Autobots again.  I sure do miss that."

Tucson sighs.
=

"So do I Quickstride, So do I."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Ca=
rroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > " I've got an idea Lord Elder... It =
worked at that Fortress, so it might work here.. My sonar transmitter.. If =
we can augment the frequency from my transmitter through the audio systems =
of this ship, we may just be able to stun that minion and any others that a=
re around the Maximal base. Of course, being careful to program the frequen=
cy so it doesn't harm Maximals or Autobots... Let's see... I've done someth=
ing to that effect before... I'll do a very mild form of the sonar transmis=
sion, and let me know if any of you feel it."
> 
> Lord Elder shook his hea=
d as Tuscon performed his test, he didn't feel
> anything either
> 
> > Som=
ething in Tucson's directory snaps. He raises a brow in alarm. Thoughts rac=
e through his mind and one suddenly hits him.
> >
> > "Wait a minute.. Lord=
 Elder, the attack on the base.... Why would they want an old base when the=
re's more to be had at the Ark? Of course... A DIVERSION! THEY'RE PLANNING =
A DIVERSION SO THEY CAN GET US AWAY FROM THE ARK!"
> 
> At Tuscon's outburs=
t, rather than being upset about it he smiled. He
> was wondering about Tus=
con's tactical ability. This showed Elder
> something about the Autobot.
> =

> "Good" he said without turning away from the controls, "You see not
> ju=
st what needs to be done, but the over all picture." The shuttle
> shuddere=
d a little as Elder spoke, but then settled back down under
> his knowledge=
able hands.
> 
> He glanced over at Tuscon about to say something else, whe=
n  the radio
> burst to life! There was static at first and then Kup's voic=
e burst
> out over the speakers.
> 
> <SHHH> <Crackle> <Crackle>  ... this =
is Kup ! What't the situation?"
> 
> Opening a channel to the Ark Elder rep=
lied, "Quickstride and I have
> rescued Rat Trap and the Autobot called Tus=
con." Elder paused for a
> moment and then continued, "Also there is a Mini=
on, one from Legacy's
> last scan, one of immense power at the old Maximal =
Base. They will
> most likely need back up there."
> 
> Elder had deliberat=
ely not mentioned that Rodimus was still captured,
> as he knew how close K=
up and Rodimus were. Instead he just continued,
> "I will be heading back t=
o your location, as we must make sure that
> the Ark remains safe. I will h=
ave to land the shuttle first though to
> affect repairs. Our last landing =
was not what I had wanted."  He said,
> refering to the rather abrupt landi=
ng the shuttle had made after
> firing on Hydras' fortress. The shuttle buc=
ked once more, but still
> maintained flight.
> 
> "What I need are volunte=
ers, to go to the old base and back up Lord
> Perseus and help him defend i=
t, or himself should he need it."
> 
> Lord Elder turned to look at the oth=
ers on the shuttle with him,
> wondering if any of them would also voluntee=
r . . . .
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
> (Lord Elder)
